With Google's vast power for capturing and remembering data, Eric Schmidt painted a picture in which technology could help quantify and verify the assertions made in policy documents. Government is highly measurable, most of it, he said. "We can actually see how many people got this shot or read this report or so forth. A government-- a transparent government-- should be able to[ measure] that."
